definition: a pass (authority to enter)/a laissez-passer or safe conduct
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
certificate/proof/to prove/to demonstrate/to confirm/variant of 症[zheng4]

sentences.english: The short horse gets a passport to the fort.
sentences.chinese: 小矮馬有一張關卡堡壘的通行證。

sentences.english: An official pass or permit, especially one for crossing national boundaries.
sentences.chinese: 證明，文件一種官方通行證或許可證，尤指過。

sentences.english: You cannot enter a military base without a permit.
sentences.chinese: 無通行證不得擅入軍事基地。

sentences.english: The green card was a passport to the American Dream.
sentences.chinese: 因爲綠卡就是一張完成美國夢的通行證。

sentences.english: I am sure this is the "certificate "of my happy jobbing later.
sentences.chinese: 相信這就是我以後快樂順利工作的通行證。

sentences.english: This pass will privilege you to attend the closed hearings.
sentences.chinese: 有了這張通行證你便可以出席不公開的聽證會。

sentences.english: The guard won't let anyone through the gate without a pass.
sentences.chinese: 哨兵不讓沒有通行證的人通過大門。

sentences.english: You won't give me the letters of transit: allright, but I want my wife to be safe.
sentences.chinese: 你可以不給我通行證，但我希望我的妻子安全離去。

sentences.english: He hadn't stolen this kiss, he'd asked permission and it had been granted.
sentences.chinese: 他沒有偷吻，他請求許可並得到通行證。

sentences.english: I have police passes for both of you.
sentences.chinese: 我給你們倆準備好了警察當局發的通行證。

sentences.english: That brother gives me Jin Shan to poison 2011 arrogant traffic permits.
sentences.chinese: 那個兄弟給我個金山毒霸2011通行證。

sentences.english: Gnat Pass was cold, but then, I was already cold.
sentences.chinese: 蚊蚋通行證是感冒，但後來，我已經感冒。

sentences.english: Sunrise, Lindis Pass, Central Otago, New Zealand.
sentences.chinese: 日出，林迪斯通行證，中央奧塔哥，新西蘭。

sentences.english: Let me watch Star Wars all summer long and pay me in movie passes.
sentences.chinese: 讓我一整個夏天都看星戰，用影院通行證當我的工資。

sentences.english: Hollywood has a laissez-passer to China's first foundry of filmmaking.
sentences.chinese: 好萊塢擁有一張通往中國首個電影製片廠的通行證。

sentences.english: You can go to any place with this password card.
sentences.chinese: 通行證，你就可以暢行無阻了。

definition: passport/CL:本[ben3],個|个[ge4]
certificate/papers/credentials/document/ID
identity card/ID
visa/certificate/to certify/CL:個|个[ge4]
identity card/also written 身份證|身份证[shen1 fen4 zheng4]
Mainland Travel Permit for Taiwan Residents/Taiwan Compatriot Entry Permit/abbr. for 台灣居民來往大陸通行證|台湾居民来往大陆通行证[Tai2 wan1 Ju1 min2 Lai2 wang3 Da4 lu4 Tong1 xing2 zheng4]
to cross a barrier/to get through (an ordeal)/to pass (a test)/to reach (a standard)
driver's license
to renew a contract/contract extension
air ticket/passenger ticket/CL:張|张[zhang1]
to pass through a country's territory/transit
certificate/proof/to prove/to demonstrate/to confirm/variant of 症[zheng4]
population (counted as number of households for census or taxation)/registered residence/residence permit/(in Hong Kong and Macau) bank account
to register (one's name)
bank card/ATM card
to board a plane
